result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Michael Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay Restitution in the amount of $2,000 to Thomas B.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Payment of restitution to be satisfied before costs, assessments and surcharges owed.

Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds - for both restitution and costs.

Concurrent with: with 104 days credit, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 14CF005690.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS immediately eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is advised that he would be eligible for release 30 days after the court is notified of successful completion of the program.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/Maintain employment - any potential employer MUST be informed of this case by the defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
No drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute Sobriety. Random screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Michael Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original DUPLICATE, PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (44 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 10, 2015 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 7  years with  104 days credit, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 14CF005690  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS immediately eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is advised that he would be eligible for release 30 days after the court is notified of successful completion of the program.

- Court sets Restitution at $2,000

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $2,000 to Thomas B.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Payment of restitution to be satisfied before costs, assessments and surcharges owed.
- Obtain/Maintain employment - any potential employer MUST be informed of this case by the defendant
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds - for both restitution and costs.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms

Crime Victim Impact Statement received and filed by the State

Letters from Wisconsin Lutheran Institutional Ministries, Inc dated September 2, 2015 and July 31, 2015 and certificate of achievement received and filed by defense counsel

Defendant Steven Michael Richardson in court with Attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Steven Michael Richardson in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

As to Count 1:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 dismissed, but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Per Local Rule, case reassigned to the Honorable Jeffrey Conen, Br. 30, due to caseload equalization.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Steven Michael Richardson not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, and Court involvement in a Jury Trial, matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Steven Michael Richardson not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and requested a plea date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge William Brash, Branch 21, in Room 632 of the Courthouse.  Clerk contacted for date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Steven Michael Richardson not in court, in custody.  
James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations; awaiting answer from drug treatment court.  


  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Michael Richardson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Steven Michael Richardson in custody.  Joanne Hardtke for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Thomas W B. or Thomas T B

Defendant Steven Michael Richardson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Steven Michael Richardson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
